title: Water bills drop by a drip! £2 saving from April
lead: Water bills are estimated to be at the same level as a decade ago

title: COP26: UK kick-starts new initiative to protect world’s rainforests
lead: The Forest, Agriculture and Commodity Trade (FACT) Dialogue brings together more than 18 countries exporting and consuming agricultural products to discuss how to make the process greener and more sustainable

title: Energy Entrepreneurs Fund: UK offers £11m to turn green ideas into reality
lead: The fund seeks to drive forward new clean technologies across all sectors of UK industry, supporting the nation’s ambition for net zero carbon emissions by 2050

title: China ‘built over three times as much coal plant capacity as the rest of the world in 2020’
lead: It commissioned almost 40GW in 2020, equivalent to building more than one large plant every week

title: Small suppliers go big in business energy market
lead: A new report finds the collective gas market share by non-large suppliers has grown from 17.0% in October 2005 to 56.2% in October 2020

title: Plants feel down too! Stress in plants can now be measured
lead: The technology is designed to detect stressful plant conditions, including drought, heat, cold and light stress

title: Siemens Gamesa to supply turbines for £6.5bn East Anglia Hub
lead: The 3.1GW offshore wind complex will feature more than 200 wind turbines

title: Energy prices return to more normal seasonal prices, but two world’s collide in carbon
lead: Energy prices return to more normal seasonal prices, but two world’s collide in carbon

title: Siemens Energy to cut 7,800 gas and power jobs to reduce costs
lead: The cuts across various departments will happen by 2025

title: Japan and ADB to promote clean energy in Southeast Asia
lead: They will focus on the areas of renewable energy, energy conservation and efficiency as well as other technologies that will facilitate the transition to low carbon energy
